title: National Government Services Portal
description: National Government Services Portal of India provides single window access to services offered by the various Indian Government entities. This Portal is an initiative under the India Portal Project and has been designed and developed by National Informatics Centre (NIC), Ministry of Electronics & Information Technology, Government of India.

items.title: Register for CMIS Employee Corner, Manipur
items.description: The CMIS Employee Corner portal of Manipur provides government employees with an easy platform to register and access essential services. By registering, employees gain access to salary details, leave records, service history, and other HR-related resources. The system streamlines employee management, ensuring efficient record-keeping and better communication between staff and administrative authorities. It also promotes transparency in service matters, allowing employees to track their personal...

items.title: Inter State Migrant Act - Application for Registration of Establishment Employing Migrant workman, Bihar
items.description: The application for registration of an establishment employing migrant workers in Bihar, under the Inter-State Migrant Workmen (Regulation of Employment and Conditions of Service) Act, 1979, is submitted using Form I (as per Rule 3(1)). This form requires details about the establishment, the principal employer, contractors (if any), and the migrant workers employed. The application, in triplicate, must be submitted to the Registering Officer of the area where the establishment is located.

items.title: Amendment of Registration of Establishments employing Contract Labour, Bihar
items.description: This service allows registered establishments in Bihar to update their contract labour registration details under the Contract Labour Act. It covers changes such as contractor information, number of workers, or nature of work. The amendment ensures that the Labour Department maintains accurate and current records for compliance and monitoring purposes.

items.title: Registration of Establishments employing Contract Labour, Bihar
items.description: This service enables principal employers in Bihar to register establishments that hire 20 or more contract workers, as per the Contract Labour (Regulation and Abolition) Act, 1970. Managed by the Labour Resources Department, this registration is mandatory and ensures proper oversight of labor welfare, rights, and safety within such establishments.

items.title: Renewal of Contract Labour Registration, Bihar
items.description: Contractors in Bihar must renew their license to legally continue employing contract labor. This service enables submission of renewal applications, ideally 30 days before expiry, using Form VII. Timely applications ensure uninterrupted licensing under the Contract Labour Act. Late submissions may attract penalties, though licenses remain valid until renewal is processed.

items.title: Contract Labour Registration, Bihar
items.description: Establishments in Bihar employing 20 or more contract workers must register under the Contract Labour (Regulation and Abolition) Act, 1970. This service allows principal employers to obtain legal authorization for engaging contract labor. It ensures adherence to statutory norms regarding wages, working conditions, and worker welfare, promoting transparent and lawful labor practices.

items.title: Building and other Construction Workers Regulation of Employment, Bihar
items.description: This service facilitates the regulation of employment and service conditions for building and construction workers in Bihar under the 2005 Act. It covers registration of establishments and workers, promotes welfare measures, and ensures safety standards at construction sites. Applicable to activities like building, repairs, roads, and railways, it aims to protect the rights and well-being of construction laborers.

items.title: Application for Non-Resident Labour Accident Compensation Scheme, Bihar
items.description: The Bihar State Migrant Labour Accident Grant Scheme, part of the Labour Resource Department, provides financial assistance to migrant workers from Bihar who suffer accidental injuries while working outside the state. To apply, individuals need to register on the portal and submit the required documents, including proof of residence, age, and details about the accident.

items.title: Apply for State and Subordinate Services (Direct Recruitment) conducted by the Public Service Commission, Rajasthan
items.description: Successful candidates in the Rajasthan State and Subordinate Services (Direct Recruitment) Combined Competitive Examination, conducted by the Rajasthan Public Service Commission (RPSC), are provided incentives by the Rajasthan Government. This scheme motivates youth to prepare for and succeed in state-level administrative and subordinate services, fostering better governance within Rajasthan.

items.title: Apply Online Application for Government Jobs Vacancies, Jammu and Kashmir
items.description: The official portal allows citizens to apply for government job vacancies in Jammu and Kashmir, simplifying the recruitment process.

items.title: Apply for MUMKIN - Livelihood Generation Scheme, Jammu and Kashmir
items.description: The MUMKIN scheme provides financial support to youth in Jammu and Kashmir, encouraging entrepreneurship and self-employment. Eligible applicants can apply online to avail benefits.

items.title: Apply for Employer Registration, Jammu and Kashmir
items.description: Employers in Jammu and Kashmir can register online or offline with District Employment & Counselling Centres. The portal supports organizations in accessing skilled candidates and managing employment-related processes.

items.title: Registration for Job Seeker, Jammu and Kashmir
items.description: Job seekers in Jammu and Kashmir can register online or offline with District Employment & Counselling Centres. The platform connects individuals to employment opportunities and career resources.

items.title: Apply for Renewal of Registration of Unemployed Youth, Jammu and Kashmir
items.description: Renewal of registration for unemployed youth in Jammu and Kashmir is made convenient through the District Employment & Counselling Centres. Users can complete the process online via the state portal or offline at designated centers.

items.title: Apply for Registration of Unemployed Youth, Jammu and Kashmir
items.description: Unemployed youth in Jammu and Kashmir can register with District Employment & Counselling Centres either online or offline. The state portal streamlines the registration process, enabling access to employment resources and opportunities.

items.title: eMigrate Project Exporter Submit Claim for PBBY Policy
items.description: Project Exporters registered under the eMigrate platform can submit insurance claims under the Pravasi Bhartiya Bima Yojana (PBBY). Managed by the Ministry of External Affairs, this service streamlines the process of claim submission and ensures timely disbursement. It supports the welfare of Indian workers employed abroad under government-approved contracts by facilitating access to policy benefits efficiently.

items.title: Track Application Status eMigrate Project Exporter
items.description: Applicants can track the status of their application for registration as a Project Exporter through the eMigrate portal. This service, provided by the Ministry of External Affairs, enables users to monitor the progress of their submission, ensuring transparency and ease of access for exporters dealing with overseas projects.

items.title: Apply for Registration eMigrate Project Exporter
items.description: Organizations involved in project exports can register under the eMigrate system. This service ensures adherence to international employment standards, facilitating smooth project implementation abroad.

items.title: eMigrate Employer Search List of Job Designation on visa
items.description: Employers can search and verify approved job designations listed on visas through this service. It ensures compliance with the employment requirements set by the Ministry of External Affairs.

items.title: eMigrate Employer Submit Claim for PBBY Policy
items.description: Employers can file claims under the Pravasi Bhartiya Bima Yojana (PBBY) policy through this service. It ensures that policyholders receive timely benefits as per the schemeâ€™s provisions.
